thread.title: Fun and games selling Pan Am Chevrolets
thread.title_full: Fun and games selling Pan Am Chevrolets | Toronto Star

author: Robin Levinson King
title: Fun and games selling Pan Am Chevrolets
text:
While driving through the city, you may have noticed some brightly decaled Chevrolets cruising down the HOV lanes.
Chevy, owned by General Motors, donated 1,200 cars for the duration of the Pan Am Games, to be used by organizers, dignitaries and athletes.
Once the games are over, the cars will go back to the dealership to be sold, said Adria MacKenzie, spokesperson for General Motors Canada.
While the cars will no longer be used to shuttle athletes around, they will come with a Pan Am medallion on the door to commemorate their role in the games.
“This is a great opportunity for fans of the Pan Am Games to drive away with a piece of the Games,” MacKenzie said.
